cards.name: Votary of the Conclave
cards.text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Votary of the Conclave.
cards.flavor: An ageless order, the votaries receive the gift of rejuvenation from the temple gardens they guard.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}: Regenerate Votary of the Conclave.

cards.name: Wojek Apothecary
cards.text: Radiance — {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it this turn.
cards.flavor: "A few arrows aren't enough to pierce your faith, soldier. You'll be back on the battlefield by sun's dawn."
cards.originalText: Radiance {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it this turn.

cards.name: Wojek Siren
cards.text: Radiance — Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It is the call to arms, the call to fury, the call to blood.
cards.originalText: Radiance Target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Belltower Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a source deals damage to Belltower Sphinx, that source's controller puts that many cards from the top of their library into their graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a source deals damage to Belltower Sphinx, that source's controller puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Cerulean Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Cerulean Sphinx's owner shuffles it into their library.
cards.flavor:
"About the sphinx, I have mixed feelings. Their wisdom I crave, but their secrecy I can't tolerate."
—Szadek
cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}: Cerulean Sphinx's owner shuffles it into his or her library.

cards.name: Compulsive Research
cards.text: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless they discard a land card.
cards.flavor: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"

rulings.text: The target player can discard either one land card or two cards which may or may not be lands. The player can discard one land and one other card or two land cards if they choose.

cards.originalText: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless he or she discards a land card.

cards.name: Convolute
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.
cards.flavor: The words came to the sorcerer's lips but refused to budge any further.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.

cards.name: Copy Enchantment
cards.text: You may have Copy Enchantment enter the battlefield as a copy of any enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Simic mages create redundant backups of their experiments to reduce the consequences of catastrophe.

rulings.text: If you choose an Aura, you also choose a legal permanent for the Copy Enchantment copy of it to enchant. Copy Enchantment doesn't target that permanent, however, so it can enter the battlefield attached to an untargetable creature.
If you choose an Aura and there isn't a legal permanent for it to enchant, you put Copy Enchantment into your graveyard. It never enters the battlefield.
If you don't choose an enchantment, Copy Enchantment enters the battlefield without copying anything, and it sits there with a useless ability.
If this is copying a Genju, such as Genju of the Fields, and the land this enchants goes to the graveyard, you will return the Copy Enchantment to your hand.
Copies all copiable values, to include mana cost, so if you copy Dream Leash, for example, the converted mana cost of Copy Enchantment will be 5.

cards.originalText: As Copy Enchantment comes into play, you may choose an enchantment in play. If you do, Copy Enchantment comes into play as a copy of that enchantment.

cards.name: Dizzy Spell
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Drake Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Drake Familiar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an enchantment to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Falconry? A fine sport I suppose, if you're attracted to the frailty of birds."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

rulings.text: The ability lets you return any enchantment on the battlefield, including an opponent's enchantment. The ability isn't targeted, so you can return an untargetable enchantment. If there are no enchantments on the battlefield, or you choose not to return one, you must sacrifice Drake Familiar.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Drake Familiar comes into play, sacrifice it unless you return an enchantment in play to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Dream Leash
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
You can't choose an untapped permanent as this spell's target as you cast it.
You control enchanted permanent.
cards.flavor: The tendrils of sorcery find easy purchase on the soft underbelly of dreams.

rulings.text: The restriction that the permanent must be tapped is checked only if you cast Dream Leash as a spell. Once Dream Leash is on the battlefield, it doesn't matter if the enchanted permanent becomes untapped.

If an effect puts Dream Leash onto the battlefield or moves it to another permanent, the permanent it becomes attached to need not be tapped. If you cast Copy Enchantment and copy Dream Leash as it enters the battlefield, the permanent it becomes attached to need not be tapped.

cards.originalText:
Enchant permanent
You may play Dream Leash only on a tapped permanent.
You control enchanted permanent.

cards.name: Drift of Phantasms
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Ethereal Usher
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
{U}, {T}: Target creature is unblockable this turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Eye of the Storm
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery card, exile it. Then that player copies each instant or sorcery card exiled with Eye of the Storm. For each copy, the player may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

rulings.text: The ability triggers when a player casts an instant or sorcery *card*. A copy of a card (such as those generated by Eye of the Storm itself) won't trigger this ability. The card that was cast is exiled and won't resolve, but the player will get a copy of the spell from Eye of the Storm.

When the ability resolves, the player copies all cards exiled with Eye of the Storm, not just the cards they own. That player then chooses which of those copies to cast, if any. All chosen copies are cast in the order the player chooses.

The player chooses modes, pays additional costs, chooses targets, and so on for the copies when casting them. Any X in the mana cost of a copy cast this way will be 0. Alternative costs can't be paid.
You must still follow any restrictions on when you can cast the spell, such as "cast only during combat" or "cast only on your own turn."
When a spell with Replicate is copied by Eye of the Storm, you have the opportunity to pay additional costs, so you may Replicate as much as you like (assuming you have the mana available).

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays an instant or sorcery card, remove it from the game. Then that player copies each instant or sorcery card removed from the game with Eye of the Storm. For each copy, the player may play the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Flight of Fancy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Flight of Fancy enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.flavor: The view from above is an inspiration to the newly winged.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Flight of Fancy comes into play, draw two cards.
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Flow of Ideas
cards.text: Draw a card for each Island you control.
cards.flavor:
"A system to direct the flow of Ravnica's entire water supply? Thinking a bit small, aren't we?"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage
cards.originalText: Draw a card for each Island you control.

cards.name: Followed Footsteps
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a token that's a copy of enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: Æther can turn a footprint into a blueprint.

rulings.text: Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature trigger when the creature tokens enter the battlefield. The creature tokens also have any "this enters the battlefield with" or "as this enters the battlefield" abilities that the copied creature has.
If Followed Footsteps moves after it has triggered, you get a copy of the newly-enchanted creature.

If Followed Footsteps and the enchanted creature leave the battlefield simultaneously (say via Upheaval or Akroma's Vengence somehow cast in response to the triggered ability), then a token copy of the creature that was enchanted when it was last on the battlefield is created. If Followed Foosteps did not enchant a creature when last on the battlefield as it went to the graveyard as a state-based action when the enchanted creature left the battlefield in response to the trigger, then no copy will get created.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a creature token into play that's a copy of enchanted creature.

cards.name: Grayscaled Gharial
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: Each tooth carries enough bacteria to kill a person in a day or two. But then, gharials do have 138 teeth.
cards.originalText: Islandwalk

cards.name: Grozoth
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Grozoth enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of cards that have converted mana cost 9, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{4}: Grozoth loses defender until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: The search ability lets you find cards whose converted mana costs are each equal to exactly 9, such as other Grozoths.

cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Grozoth comes into play, you may search your library for any number of cards that have converted mana cost 9, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{4}: Grozoth loses defender until end of turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U}

cards.name: Halcyon Glaze
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Halcyon Glaze becomes a 4/4 Illusion creature with flying in addition to its other types until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Earth to æther, window to wonder, stillness to the sky."
—Glazing incantation

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell, Halcyon Glaze becomes a 4/4 Illusion creature with flying until end of turn. It's still an enchantment.

cards.name: Hunted Phantasm
cards.text:
Hunted Phantasm can't be blocked.
When Hunted Phantasm enters the battlefield, target opponent creates five 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.originalText:
Hunted Phantasm is unblockable.
When Hunted Phantasm comes into play, put five 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play under target opponent's control.

cards.name: Induce Paranoia
cards.text: Counter target spell. If {B} was spent to cast Induce Paranoia, that spell's controller puts the top X cards of their library into their graveyard, where X is the spell's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell. If {B} was spent to play Induce Paranoia, that spell's controller puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Lore Broker
cards.text: {T}: Each player draws a card, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: Lies are sold as often as truths—and used just as effectively.
cards.originalText: {T}: Each player draws a card, then discards a card.

cards.name: Mark of Eviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, return enchanted creature and all Auras attached to that creature to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Tharashk the Bold suddenly wasn't himself. Or anyone else, for that matter.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, return enchanted creature and all Auras attached to that creature to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Mnemonic Nexus
cards.text: Each player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor: True enlightenment comes not with a new thought, but with understanding of all the old ones.

rulings.text: This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

cards.originalText: Each player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Muddle the Mixture
cards.text:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Peel from Reality
cards.text: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: When House Dimir's secrets are in danger of exposure, the guild takes drastic measures to cover its tracks.
cards.originalText: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Quickchange
cards.text:
Target creature becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Most Ravnicans lead lives of desperate survival. Those who thrive are malleable enough to change with the ever-shifting politics of the guilds.

rulings.text: You can choose any single color or any combination of more than one color. You can't choose colorless.
Quickchange won't make an artifact stop being an artifact. It'll just be a colorful artifact.

cards.originalText:
Target creature's color becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Remand
cards.text:
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it into its owner's hand instead of into that player's graveyard.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Well, at least all of that arm-waving and arcane babbling you did was impressive."

rulings.text: The countered spell goes to its owner's hand from the stack. It never hits the graveyard.
If you Remand a card with Flashback, the card will still be exiled.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell. If you do, return that spell card to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The irritable drakes are solitary nesters. Even brooding females barely contain the urge to attack their own young.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Spawnbroker
cards.text: When Spawnbroker enters the battlefield, you may exchange control of target creature you control and target creature with power less than or equal to that creature's power an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "The trick isn't setting up the bad trade. It's making each side think it got the better deal."

rulings.text: If either target becomes illegal (say, if a creature's power has changed such that the creature you control now has less power than the other creature), then the exchange won't happen.

cards.originalText: When Spawnbroker comes into play, you may exchange control of target creature you control and target creature with power less than or equal to that creature's power an opponent controls.

cards.name: Stasis Cell
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.

cards.name: Surveilling Sprite
cards.text:
Flying
When Surveilling Sprite dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Their natural curiosity, combined with a knack for trespassing, makes sprites excellent spies.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Surveilling Sprite is put into a graveyard from play, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Tattered Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Tattered Drake.
cards.flavor:
"Drakes embody the worst of Ravnica: great potential, twisted by selfishness and greed."
—Razia
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Tattered Drake.

cards.name: Telling Time
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

rulings.text: If there are fewer than three cards in your library, follow the instructions in the order given for any cards that are there.

cards.originalText: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Terraformer
cards.text: {1}: Choose a basic land type. Each land you control becomes that type until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "This feels a little more like home."

rulings.text: Terraformer's effect overwrites the land type of all lands you control that had other types and gives a land type to all lands you control that don't normally have one.
Changing a land's type doesn't change its name or whether it's legendary or basic.
Lands you control will have the mana ability of the basic land type you choose (for example, Forests can tap to produce green mana) and will lose all other innate abilities they had.

cards.originalText: {1}: Choose a basic land type. The land type of each land you control becomes that type until end of turn.

cards.name: Tidewater Minion
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Tidewater Minion loses defender until end of turn.
{T}: Untap target permanent.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Tidewater Minion loses defender until end of turn.
{T}: Untap target permanent.

cards.name: Tunnel Vision
cards.text: Choose a card name. Target player reveals cards from the top of their library until a card with that name is revealed. If it is, that player puts the rest of the revealed cards into their graveyard and puts the card with the chosen name on top of their library. Otherwise, the player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: If the named card is found, everything from the top of the library down to the named card is put into the graveyard and the library isn't shuffled. If the named card isn't in the library, no cards are put into the graveyard and the library is shuffled.

cards.originalText: Name a card. Target player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until the named card is revealed. If it is, that player puts the rest of the revealed cards into his or her graveyard and puts the named card on top of his or her library. Otherwise, the player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Vedalken Dismisser
cards.text: When Vedalken Dismisser enters the battlefield, put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"I crept up on him, quiet as a guttermouse. And then suddenly I found myself facedown in a latrine pit behind Tin Street Market."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

rulings.text: If Vedalken Dismisser is the only creature on the battlefield when its ability triggers, you'll have to choose it as the target.

foreignNames.name: ヴィダルケンの放逐者

cards.originalText: When Vedalken Dismisser comes into play, put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Vedalken Entrancer
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: Their denial reaches far into your future.

foreignNames.name: ヴィダルケンの幻惑者

cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Wizened Snitches
cards.text:
Flying
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
cards.flavor:
"Be careful what information you ask them to find, for it will likely be the subject of tale time at the alehouse."
—Sirislav, Dimir spy

rulings.text: The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
When playing with the top card of your library revealed, if an effect tells you to draw several cards, reveal each one before you draw it.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.

cards.name: Zephyr Spirit
cards.text: When Zephyr Spirit blocks, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: A spiteful force exists on Ravnica that binds these ghosts to the land of the living but forbids them to touch it.
cards.originalText: When Zephyr Spirit blocks, return it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Blood Funnel
cards.text:
Noncreature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, counter that spell unless you sacrifice a creature.
cards.originalText:
Noncreature spells you play cost {2} less to play.
Whenever you play a noncreature spell, counter that spell unless you sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Brainspoil
cards.text:
Destroy target creature that isn't enchanted. It can't be regenerated.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Destroy target creature that isn't enchanted. It can't be regenerated.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Carrion Howler
cards.text: Pay 1 life: Carrion Howler gets +2/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They chase tirelessly after the bone-carts that speed along the streets of the Plague Quarter.
cards.originalText: Pay 1 life: Carrion Howler gets +2/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Clinging Darkness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-1.
cards.flavor: There's an experience worse than blindness—it's the certainty that your vision is perfect and the horror that there's no world around you to see.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-1.

cards.name: Dark Confidant
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: Greatness, at any cost.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Darkblast
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Dimir House Guard
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Dimir House Guard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Fear
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Dimir House Guard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Dimir Machinations
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library. Exile any number of those cards, then put the rest back in any order.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library. Remove any number of those cards from the game, then put the rest back in any order.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Disembowel
cards.text: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor:
"We thought we found the victim's clothes lumped in the street. As it turned out, it was the victim, insides sucked out—just a sack of skin and robes."
—Agrus Kos
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost X.

cards.name: Empty the Catacombs
cards.text: Each player returns all creature cards from their graveyard to their hand.
cards.flavor: When the dead are laid to rest in Ravnica, it's usually just a nap.
cards.originalText: Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.

cards.name: Golgari Thug
cards.text:
When Golgari Thug dies, put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly four cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
When Golgari Thug is put into a graveyard from play, put target creature card in your graveyard on top of your library.
Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly four cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Helldozer
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, untap Helldozer.
cards.flavor: Sometimes you go to hell, and sometimes hell comes to you.
cards.originalText: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target land. If that land is nonbasic, untap Helldozer.

cards.name: Hex
cards.text: Destroy six target creatures.
cards.flavor: When killing five just isn't enough.

rulings.text: You must target six different creatures. If you can't, you can't cast Hex. If some of the creatures become illegal targets before the spell resolves, Hex will still destroy the rest of them.

cards.originalText: Destroy six target creatures.

cards.name: Hunted Horror
cards.text:
Trample
When Hunted Horror enters the battlefield, target opponent creates two 3/3 green Centaur creature tokens with protection from black.
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Hunted Horror comes into play, put two 3/3 green Centaur creature tokens with protection from black into play under target opponent's control.

cards.name: Infectious Host
cards.text: When Infectious Host dies, target player loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Lost man, dead man, knocking on the door.
Cankerman, soreman, knock no more."
—Ravnican children's rhyme
cards.originalText: When Infectious Host is put into a graveyard from play, target player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Keening Banshee
cards.text:
Flying
When Keening Banshee enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Her cold wail echoes in the alleys and under-eaves, finding the unfortunate and turning their blood to ice.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Keening Banshee comes into play, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Last Gasp
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Allow me a moment to catch your breath."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mausoleum Turnkey
cards.text: When Mausoleum Turnkey enters the battlefield, return target creature card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: When he reaches for his key ring, you should be running for the exit.
cards.originalText: When Mausoleum Turnkey comes into play, return target creature card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Moonlight Bargain
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. For each card, put that card into your graveyard unless you pay 2 life. Then put the rest into your hand.
cards.flavor: At every fifth full moon, the Moon Market convenes to peddle Ravnica's most forbidden wares.

foreignNames.name: Trato a la luz de la luna

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. For each card, put that card into your graveyard unless you pay 2 life. Then put the rest into your hand.

cards.name: Mortipede
cards.text: {2}{G}: All creatures able to block Mortipede this turn do so.
cards.flavor: Mortipede pheromones choke the streets with sickly sweetness, luring the rash and unwary into its waiting jaws.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}: All creatures able to block Mortipede this turn do so.

cards.name: Necromantic Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: The target is chosen just after any creatures dealt lethal damage at the same time that the enchanted creature dealt damage have been put into the graveyard. That might include the enchanted creature itself, if it had trample and was blocked, for example.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Necroplasm
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Necroplasm.
At the beginning of your end step, destroy each creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Necroplasm.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Necroplasm.
At the end of your turn, destroy each creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Necroplasm.
Dredge 2

cards.name: Netherborn Phalanx
cards.text:
When Netherborn Phalanx enters the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life for each creature they control.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
When Netherborn Phalanx comes into play, each opponent loses 1 life for each creature he or she controls.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Nightmare Void
cards.text:
Target player reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText:
Target player reveals his or her hand. Choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Ribbons of Night
cards.text: Ribbons of Night deals 4 damage to target creature and you gain 4 life. If {U} was spent to cast Ribbons of Night, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"My favorite meal is angel's flesh, slain in agony and iced with black vinegar."
—Aszala of House Dimir
cards.originalText: Ribbons of Night deals 4 damage to target creature and you gain 4 life. If {U} was spent to play Ribbons of Night, draw a card.

cards.name: Roofstalker Wight
cards.text: {1}{U}: Roofstalker Wight gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: No heartbeat to hear, no greed to bribe, no fear of death.
cards.originalText: {1}{U}: Roofstalker Wight gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Sadistic Augermage
cards.text: When Sadistic Augermage dies, each player puts a card from their hand on top of their library.
cards.flavor: "Don't worry. I know the drill."

foreignNames.name: サディストの穴開け魔道士

cards.originalText: When Sadistic Augermage is put into a graveyard from play, each player puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.

cards.name: Sewerdreg
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Sacrifice Sewerdreg: Exile target card from a graveyard.
cards.flavor: They hardly have form, dripping through pipe and grate with the slip and stench of flowing sewage.
cards.originalText:
Swampwalk
Sacrifice Sewerdreg: Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.

cards.name: Shred Memory
cards.text:
Exile up to four target cards from a single graveyard.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Remove up to four target cards in a single graveyard from the game.
Transmute {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Play only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Sins of the Past
cards.text: Until end of turn, you may cast target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into your graveyard this turn, exile it instead. Exile Sins of the Past.

rulings.text: The instant or sorcery card is cast from your graveyard, not your hand. You choose modes, pay additional costs, choose targets, etc. for the spell as normal when casting it. Any X in the mana cost will be 0. Alternative costs can't be paid.
The instant or sorcery card never gets put back into your graveyard, even if it's countered. You can't cast it more than once.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, you may play target instant or sorcery card in your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into your graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead. Remove Sins of the Past from the game.

cards.name: Stinkweed Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
Notably, Stinkweed Imp's ability isn't deathtouch. It's a triggered ability that triggers only on combat damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Strands of Undeath
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Strands of Undeath enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
{B}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Why limit yourself to mortal law when you can outlive those who enforce it?"
—Czaric, Orzhov prelate
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Strands of Undeath comes into play, target player discards two cards.
{B}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Thoughtpicker Witch
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at the top two cards of target opponent's library, then exile one of them.
cards.flavor: "Once the brew gets the brains nice and pickled, they're a lot easier to pick through."
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at the top two cards of target opponent's library, then remove one of them from the game.

cards.name: Undercity Shade
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{B}: Undercity Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Officially, there's nothing under that bridge to hunt . . . Unofficially, my torchers are too terrified to go there after nightfall."
—Agrus Kos
cards.originalText:
Fear
{B}: Undercity Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vigor Mortis
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counter from this ability is in addition to any other counters the creature enters the battlefield with.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. If {G} was spent to play Vigor Mortis, that creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Vindictive Mob
cards.text:
When Vindictive Mob enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
Vindictive Mob can't be blocked by Saprolings.
cards.flavor: Many minds, a single madness.
cards.originalText:
When Vindictive Mob comes into play, sacrifice a creature.
Vindictive Mob can't be blocked by Saprolings.

cards.name: Woebringer Demon
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature. If the player can't, sacrifice Woebringer Demon.
cards.flavor: Each soul he devours adds its hunger to his own.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature. If the player can't, sacrifice Woebringer Demon.

cards.name: Barbarian Riftcutter
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Riftcutter: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"Riftcutters are suicidal anarchists, waving those lightning axes around so much that the walls are as likely to fall as their foes."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Riftcutter: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Blockbuster
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice Blockbuster: It deals 3 damage to each tapped creature and each player.
cards.flavor: Vendors hung cords heavy with roots and laid out boxes of salted meat, unaware of the fiery disaster swiftly approaching.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}, Sacrifice Blockbuster: Blockbuster deals 3 damage to each tapped creature and each player.

cards.name: Breath of Fury
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, sacrifice it and attach Breath of Fury to a creature you control. If you do, untap all creatures you control and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

rulings.text: If there isn't a legal creature to attach Breath of Fury to after the enchanted creature is sacrificed, you don't untap your creatures or get an additional combat phase, and Breath of Fury is put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, sacrifice it and attach Breath of Fury to a creature you control. If you do, untap all creatures you control and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Char
cards.text: Char deals 4 damage to any target and 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Izzet mages often acquire their magic reagents from dubious sources, so the potency of their spells is never predictable.
cards.originalText: Char deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Cleansing Beam
cards.text: Radiance — Cleansing Beam deals 2 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.
cards.flavor:
"Justice is toothless without punishment. Righteousness cannot succeed without the suffering of the guilty."
—Razia

rulings.text: All creatures that share a color are affected, even your own.

A creature "shares a color" with any creature that is at least one of its colors. For example, a green-white creature shares a color with creatures that are green, white, green-white, red-white, black-green, and so on.
If it targets a colorless creature, it doesn't affect any other creatures. A colorless creature shares a color with nothing, not even other colorless creatures.
You check which creatures share a color with the target when the spell resolves.
Only one creature is targeted. If that creature leaves the battlefield or otherwise becomes an illegal target, the entire spell doesn't resolve. No other creatures are affected.

cards.originalText: Radiance Cleansing Beam deals 2 damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it.

cards.name: Coalhauler Swine
cards.text: Whenever Coalhauler Swine is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to each player.
cards.flavor: Nothing stops industry in Ravnica—certainly not the safety of its workers.
cards.originalText: Whenever Coalhauler Swine is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to each player.

cards.name: Dogpile
cards.text: Dogpile deals damage to any target equal to the number of attacking creatures you control.
cards.flavor: There is no shelter from this storm, its rain of fists, or the thunderous cackles of bloodlust.
cards.originalText: Dogpile deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of attacking creatures you control.

cards.name: Excruciator
cards.text: Damage that would be dealt by Excruciator can't be prevented.
cards.flavor:
"Though used as a piercing weapon, the tusk is more akin to a stinger, spreading pain instantly throughout the body of its victim. This specimen deserves further study."
—Simic research notes

rulings.text: An effect may redirect Excruciator's damage.
Excruciator can deal damage to creatures with protection from red. (It can't block creatures with protection from red, though.)
Damage prevention shields that would prevent this damage aren't used up and they stick around for the next time something would deal damage.
A creature dealt lethal damage by Excruciator can be regenerated.
Replacement effects that don't use the word "prevent" can replace Excruciator's damage with something else. See Phytohydra and Szadek, Lord of Secrets, for example.

cards.originalText: Damage that would be dealt by Excruciator can't be prevented.

cards.name: Fiery Conclusion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Fiery Conclusion deals 5 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Boros legionnaire saw a noble sacrifice, the Rakdos thug a blazing suicide, and the Izzet alchemist an experiment gone awry.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Fiery Conclusion, sacrifice a creature.
Fiery Conclusion deals 5 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Flame Fusillade
cards.text: Until end of turn, permanents you control gain "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to any target."
cards.flavor:
"A single item acting as lantern and lance? Now that's military efficiency."
—Brev Grezar, Boros lieutenant

rulings.text: "Summoning sickness" applies only to creatures, not to other permanents. You may tap a noncreature permanent to pay for an ability with {T} in its cost even if the permanent entered the battlefield that turn.
Tapping an Aura or Equipment doesn't tap the creature it's attached to and vice versa. Tapped enchantments work normally. Tapped artifacts work normally unless they say otherwise.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, permanents you control gain "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Flash Conscription
cards.text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. If {W} was spent to cast Flash Conscription, the creature gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain that much life" until end of turn.

rulings.text: If white mana was paid, the player who controls the creature when it deals combat damage will be the one who gains life.

cards.originalText: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. If {W} was spent to play Flash Conscription, the creature gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain that much life" until end of turn.

cards.name: Frenzied Goblin
cards.text: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: The upside to not thinking about the consequences is that you'll always surprise those who do.

rulings.text: Frenzied Goblin's ability has only one target. You can't pay {R} multiple times to stop multiple creatures from blocking.

cards.originalText: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Galvanic Arc
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Galvanic Arc enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to any target.
Enchanted creature has first strike.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Galvanic Arc comes into play, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Enchanted creature has first strike.

cards.name: Goblin Fire Fiend
cards.text:
Haste
Goblin Fire Fiend must be blocked if able.
{R}: Goblin Fire Fiend gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If Goblin Fire Fiend is attacking, the defending player must assign at least one blocker to it during the declare blockers step if that player controls any creatures that could block Goblin Fire Fiend.

cards.originalText:
Haste
Defending player blocks Goblin Fire Fiend if able.
{R}: Goblin Fire Fiend gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Spelunkers
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: Chimney sweeps, explorers of abandoned buildings, spire climbers . . . goblin spelunkers have found countless niches within Ravnica's metropolis.

foreignNames.name: ゴブリンの洞窟探検家

cards.originalText: Mountainwalk

cards.name: Greater Forgeling
cards.text: {1}{R}: Greater Forgeling gets +3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Few have seen the inner workings of Ravnica's furnaces, but neighboring districts catch brief glimpses in the horrors that escape the flames.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Greater Forgeling gets +3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hammerfist Giant
cards.text: {T}: Hammerfist Giant deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Oh sure, they buy a lot of ale, but I always find myself needing to rebuild after the giants have paid a visit."
—Belko, owner of Titan's Keg tavern
cards.originalText: {T}: Hammerfist Giant deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Hunted Dragon
cards.text:
Flying, haste
When Hunted Dragon enters the battlefield, target opponent creates three 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with first strike.
cards.flavor: The knights see a mighty quarry. The dragon sees breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

rulings.text: The tokens are the color white and have name and creature type Knight. They are *not* functionally identical to the card White Knight.

foreignNames.name: 狩り立てられたドラゴン

cards.originalText:
Flying, haste
When Hunted Dragon comes into play, put three 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with first strike into play under target opponent's control.

cards.name: Incite Hysteria
cards.text: Radiance — Until end of turn, target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain "This creature can't block."
cards.flavor:
"The Boros say they want to bring order to Ravnica. Funny then, how well they use chaos."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

rulings.text: All creatures that share a color are affected, even your own.

A creature "shares a color" with any creature that is at least one of its colors. For example, a green-white creature shares a color with creatures that are green, white, green-white, red-white, black-green, and so on.
If it targets a colorless creature, it doesn't affect any other creatures. A colorless creature shares a color with nothing, not even other colorless creatures.
You check which creatures share a color with the target when the spell resolves.
Only one creature is targeted. If that creature leaves the battlefield or otherwise becomes an illegal target, the entire spell doesn't resolve. No other creatures are affected.

The targeted creature and the creatures that share a color with it at the time Incite Hysteria resolves gain an ability that says they can't block this turn. It doesn't matter if those creatures change colors before blockers are declared.

cards.originalText: Radiance Creatures that share a color with target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Indentured Oaf
cards.text: Prevent all damage that Indentured Oaf would deal to red creatures.
cards.flavor: All it knows is the difference between friend and food.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that Indentured Oaf would deal to red creatures.

cards.name: Instill Furor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice this creature unless it attacked this turn."
cards.flavor:
"The Rakdos know little of technology, but they definitely know how to push buttons."
—Trivaz, Izzet mage

rulings.text: Instill Furor grants a triggered ability that triggers at the end of the creature's controller's turn.
Once the ability triggers, nothing that happens to Instill Furor can prevent the ability from resolving.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the end of your turn, sacrifice this creature unless it attacked this turn."
